title: About
text:
About this site:
This webpage was created for my STAT 365 course.

About me: View My Resume
I currently go to Cal Poly, and am enrolled in the undergraduate Statistics program there. I also have a Mathematics minor. My expected graduation date is June 2026.
My GitHub can be found here: https://github.com/mararva
My LinkedIn can be found here: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryan-marangattu/

title: Ryan V Marangattu
text:
Hello! I am a current Statistics student at Cal Poly.
To learn more about me, visit the About Me page.
To view my resume, visit the Resume page.
Any projects I work on will be posted to the Projects page.

title: Ryan M
text:
EMAIL: ryanmarangattu@gmail.com
PROFILE: I am a current Cal Poly student looking to gain real-world job experience and professional development via internship in the fields of finance and data science.
WORK EXPERIENCE
* June 2017 – June 2020(seasonal)            Machinist at Arch Machining, Los Angeles
Sorted and analyzed terabytes of raw data for the company archives. Assisted in managing budgets. Operated CNC machinery and processed final products.
EDUCATION
* August 2021 – June 2025(expected) California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo
BA, Statistics, Minor in Mathematics
SKILLS
Advanced Computer Skills
Highly proficient in MS Office and Google Suite
Works with R and JMP
Writing Skills
Ability to Multitask
Communication Skills
Ability to Work in a Team
Detail Oriented and Efficiency Minded
Adaptability and Perseverance
REFERENCES
* Varghese Joseph, Arch Machining joseph@archmachining.com

title: Copy the Masters: FiveThirtyEight
text: In this project, I reproduced a graphic from FiveThirtyEight using R and the ggplot package.

title: The Battle of Riddler Nation!
text: In this project, I recreated the Colonel Blotto game, a well known game theory problem, using RShiny. This project is available at https://maranheads.shinyapps.io/331project/.

title: Contributions to the Tidyverse
text: As part of an independent study course I took at Cal Poly in Fall 2024, I contributed to the stringr package of the “tidyverse” in R.
